result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew N McMurtry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court orders the defendant to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge by 9-2-17 or a civil judgment shall be entered.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence with credit for 204 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew N McMurtry

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant requesting payment plan.  (Matthew N. McMurtry - #357899, Marshall E. Sherrer Correctional Center, 1318 N 14th St, Milwaukee WI 53205).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing statements to the court by the state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence with credit for 204 days time served.  
The Court orders the defendant to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge by 9-2-2017 or a civil judgment shall be entered.
Defendant is remanded.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief signed and filed.

As to AMENDED Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of no contest.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38 on the previously scheduled Jury trial date.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for final pretrial.  Amended Information received and filed.  Parties have reached a resolution and are ready to proceed with plea hearing. 

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 393.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.   Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.
Defense counsel unable to appear today for Final pretrial.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 38 on 08-28-2014 at 8:15 am for Final pretrial.  Clerk contacted ADA Shomin of new date.

from defendant: Notice of Motion to Suppress and Dismiss
from Division of Hearing and Appeals 2 CD's of revocation hearing
Received from defendant, request to fire his attorney.  Copy of request is mailed to Atty Haney.

Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  The defense requests time to have a revocation hearing transcribed.  The court adjourns final pre-trial, case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.

State's Motion to Preclude Defendant From Pursuing Third Party Defense at Trial & Precluding Introduction of Evidence Concerning Irrelevant Battery to the Defendant by Parties Other Than the Victim received and filed.
Defense pro-se motion to suppress and dismiss received and filed.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, received and filed. cmt

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Matthew N McMurtry not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
IN CHAMBERS discussion held.  Case called.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  ADA Falk is still in trial in Branch 25 and there is not an available ADA to try case for the state.  Defendant is currently in revocation proceedings so the speedy trial is not applicable.
Case set for final pretrial on 7-30-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 9-2-2014 at 8:15am.
Filed by defense, Motion and Brief in Support of Arguing Alternative Theory of Case. cmt
of defense received and filed.
defendant's requested jury instructions received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is set for jury trial on 5-19-2014(speedy).  The State is objecting to the defense request that it receive a copy of dashcam video pertaining to the defendant which is after the charged incident in this case.  The State does not believe that it is relevant to this matter.  Court directs that the  State provide the video to defense by Friday, May 9.
State's offer if placed on the record and the defendant rejects it.  PRO SE Motion to Dismiss is withdrawn.
Jury trial date of 5-19-2014 to stand.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.
received and filed

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Matthew N McMurtry not in court, in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for Miriam Falk for the State of Wisconsin.  New counsel has been appointed.  Atty Earle has provided discovery to Atty Haney.  Speedy trial demand reasserted as of today's date.  Trial date of 5-19-2014 to remain.
Case set for final pretrial on 5-5-2014.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel motion to withdraw as counsel at request of defendant heard and GRANTED.
The Court finds cause to waive the speedy trial demand previously entered, but advises the defendant he may re-assert once new counsel is appointed.  Atty Earle will contact the SPD for appointment of  new counsel.  Jury trial date of 5-19-2014 is to stand unless new counsel is unavailable.
Case is adjourned to 4-11-2014 for status of counsel.

for leave to withdraw as counsel received and filed.
Motion to be heard on final pretrial date of 4-4-2014.

Attorney Patrick T Earle in court, defendant Matthew N McMurtry not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is in trial.  Parties contact the clerk via phone and dates selected.
Case set for final pretrial on 4-4-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-19-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-21-2014.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Patrick T Earle.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the crimianl complaint to reflect the correction of the name of police officer "Paloma Winkelmann" on page (1).  Sworn for the state:Paloma Winkelmann-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.A.H. (DOB:  05/06/1999) and the address of 4175 N. 71st St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Matthew N McMurtry in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
